member.name: P:KrispWare.KrispControl.ApplicationPath
member.summary: The URL to the root of the current web application for this website. Used only for design-support.

member.name: T:KrispWare.ImageCropper
member.summary: Displays an image that allows the user to drag a rectangle over it and return the cropped portion as an image bitmap.
member.remarks: To use, set the ImageUrl property to the URL of the image you want cropped, and handle the ImageCropped event to retrieve a bitmap of the cropped portion of the image.

member.name: F:KrispWare.ImageCropper.croppingRectChanged
member.summary: The url of the tiled background image to use for the cropped image bitmap in order to achieve the specified dimensions.
member.remarks:
If CroppedWidth, CroppedHeight and AspectRatio are all set then the cropped bitmap will appear with strips of the image specified by the BackgroundImageUrl on either the top and bottom or the left and right sides to achieve the the proper dimensions without distorting the image.
If this property is not set the background will be solid black.

member.name: M:KrispWare.ImageCropper.OnImageCropped(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Raises the ImageCropped event.

member.name: M:KrispWare.ImageCropper.GetImageBitmap
member.summary: Retrieves a bitmap of the image specified in ImageUrl.
member.remarks: You must subclass ImageCropper and override this method if the image specified by ImageUrl requires credentials or a session cookie to access, since the image is retrieved via an HTTP GET request.

member.name: P:KrispWare.ImageCropper.ImageUrl
member.summary: The absolute or relative URL of the image you want cropped.
member.remarks: This property is identical to the WebControl.ImageUrl property.

member.name: P:KrispWare.ImageCropper.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the image as shown in the browser.
member.remarks: This property is identical to the WebControl.Width property.

member.name: P:KrispWare.ImageCropper.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the image as shown in the browser.
member.remarks: This property is identical to the Image.Height property.

member.name: P:KrispWare.ImageCropper.CropBorderColor
member.summary: The border color of the cropping rectangle.

member.name: P:KrispWare.ImageCropper.CropBorderStyle
member.summary: The border style of the cropping rectangle.

member.name: P:KrispWare.ImageCropper.CropBorderWidth
member.summary: The border width of the cropping rectangle.

member.name: P:KrispWare.ImageCropper.Lightness
member.summary: The lightness of the cropped portion of the image.
member.remarks: 100 is the lightness of the original image. 0 is black. The default is 50.

member.name: P:KrispWare.ImageCropper.CroppedWidth
member.summary: If non-zero, the fixed width of the cropped image bitmap.

member.name: P:KrispWare.ImageCropper.CroppedHeight
member.summary: If non-zero, the fixed height of the cropped image bitmap.

member.name: P:KrispWare.ImageCropper.AspectRatio
member.summary: If non-zero the aspect ratio (width divided by height) of the cropping rectangle the user drags over the image will be fixed at the specified value.

member.name: P:KrispWare.ImageCropper.MaxAspect
member.summary: If true and AspectRatio is non-zero and CroppingRect is equal to Rectangle.Empty then the cropping rectangle will default to the largest possible rectangle that fits into the image while maintaining the given aspect ratio. The rectangle will be centered horizontally or vertically depending on whether the aspect ratio is greater than or less than the aspect ratio of the image.

member.name: P:KrispWare.ImageCropper.PreventResizing
member.summary: If true the user may move the initial cropping rectangle but may not resize it.
member.note: If an initial cropping rectangle is not specified, either through setting CroppingRect or both AspectRatio and MaxAspect, then user will not be able to crop the image.

member.name: P:KrispWare.ImageCropper.CroppingRect
member.summary: The rectangle that represents the state of the cropping region overlayed on the image.
member.remarks:
Set this value in order to display a default cropping region over the image. To remove the default region, set this property to Rectangle.Empty.
The dimensions specified here are relative to the original dimensions of the image specified by the ImageUrl property and not to the dimensions the image as it is displayed on the webpage. (which can be modified via the Width and Height properties.)
Changing this property also changes the CroppedImage bitmap.
The dimensions of CroppedImage are not necessarily the same as this rectangle, although the aspect ratio will be the same. (see CroppedHeight and CroppedWidth)
If the aspect ratio of the default cropping rectangle is different than a specified AspectRatio unexpected behavior may result.

member.name: P:KrispWare.ImageCropper.CroppedImage
member.summary: A bitmap of the cropped image.
member.remarks: Typically this property is retrieved in the handler for the ImageCropped event. It is null until the user crops the image and posts back or the CroppingRect property is set manually.

member.name: P:KrispWare.ImageCropper.OnDragJScript
member.summary: A javascript method to be executed continuously on the client when a user is changing the crop rectangle.
member.remarks: The method specified is passed five parameters in this order: the ClientID, cropping rectangle offset left, offset top, width, and height.

member.name: P:KrispWare.ImageCropper.OnDropJScript
member.summary: A javascript method to be executed once after the user has finished changing the crop rectangle.
member.remarks: The method specified is passed five parameters in this order: the ClientID, cropping rectangle offset left, offset top, width, and height.

member.name: E:KrispWare.ImageCropper.ImageCropped
member.summary: Occurs when the image has been cropped.
member.remarks: The ImageCropped event is raised when the user crops the image and then submits the form.
